Future directions of VANETs include:

1. Advancements in privacy-preserving authentication methods: Research continues to focus on developing new and more advanced privacy-preserving authentication methods that can provide better security and performance while protecting the privacy of vehicles and their passengers.
2. Integration with other technologies: VANETs are expected to be integrated with other technologies such as 5G networks, IoT devices, and cloud computing to provide new services and applications.
3. Development of intelligent transportation systems (ITS): VANETs will play an important role in the development of ITS, which aims to improve road safety and traffic efficiency by providing real-time information to vehicles and enabling advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS).
4. Autonomous vehicles: VANETs will be crucial for the communication and coordination of autonomous vehicles, which are expected to become a major component of future transportation systems.
5. Cybersecurity: As VANETs become more widespread, it will be important to ensure their security against cyber-attacks, which could have a significant impact on the safety and efficiency of the transportation system.
6. Standardization: There is a need for standardization of protocols and interfaces for VANETs to ensure interoperability and ease of deployment.
7. Research and development of V2X (vehicle-to-everything) communication: VANETs will be a crucial component of V2X communication, which allows vehicles to communicate with other vehicles, infrastructure, and even with pedestrians and bicycles.

Overall, the future of VANETs is expected to be characterized by the integration of various technologies and the development of new services and applications that can improve the safety, efficiency, and comfort of transportation.
